column2: Frank, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Have used both Levemir and Lantus.  I find no difference in effectiveness.  I take 15 units once a day and Humalog at each meal 3-5 units.  Also take 2000 mg of metformin.  HbA1c stable at around 7.2.  Normally in the 100 to 200 range.  Only over 200 if I eat a big meal or large snack.  No problems with going too low.  Works good for me.

column2: tideflash, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been using levimer for 8 months. I also use glimiperide and metformin pills. When I went on Levimer my blood sugar readings were as high as 390. Now they range from 114 average and as low as 85 if I have a very small meal in the evening.  My weight has only fluctuated a few pounds.  The injections using a needle and vial are usually okay but rarely will hurt if I inject into a harder muscular area of my stomach.  I experience a little bleeding about 1 out of 5 injections.

column2: Alphadog, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I switched from Lantus 2 years ago because of painful injection at the site. I have had the best experience by taking 20u in AM and 20u PM. as long as I DON'T EAT High carb food within 2 hrs of sleeoing (that bedtime bowl of cereal had to go) I consistantly wake up with an 80 to 100 count. My A1C has also maintained 6.7 to 6.9. Very happy with product.

column2: Levinsonbill, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Is this similar to Lantus?

column2: PittyPat, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Started taking Levemir 1/1/12. It has helped me to loose a few pounds. I find that if I eat more than I should, I get nauseaus (extremely) but if I eat smaller portions I don't get that feeling. So I am eating amaller portions and dropping some weight, a good thing for me. I will continue taking it, used to use Humalog every few hours, using the Levemir 1 sometimes 2 times a day.  Made it through a whole month on just the 5 pen box--very unusal for me.  It works for me, glad I was able to try it.

column1: Diabetes Mellitus with Severe Insulin Resistance
column2: diabetic01, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Been type 1 diabetic for 44 years. Didn't like Lantus, went back on NPH. Been trying the Levemir - hate it. Site itching. Up to twice my former doses and sugars been spiking to 500 despite eating very little and no carbs other than vegetables. Definately telling the doctor to switch me back this week.

column2: Natalie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Started taking Levemir 8 days ago.  Until reading about side effects, I could not understand why I was too weak to carry laundry upstairs, to hold the phone to my ear, became teary, light-headed, nauseated, and experienced rapid hearbeats on a couple of occasions.  I also mistook the redness on ta few injectin sites as potential infection so treated with antibiotic creams and oral medication.  I've been a T1 for 31 years and have never experienced such a plethora of general health issues at once so decided to look into Levemir side effects.  I am very relieved to learn that severe weakness, rapid heartbeat, and skin irritations are side effects of this med.  I've decided to go back to my old-school NPH and get my life back.  Will fyi the doc during my next appointment.

column2: barbara, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Just started on this medication.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I used Levemir for about 4 months.  I had pain with every injection and developed large bruises and thickened, lumpy skin. The bruising got so severe that my doctor determined I was allergic to the drug and switched me to Humalog.

column2: SPinHP, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've steadily gone up from 10 units to 60. 60 doesn't even work! My morning readings are 350 with this and 250 when I don't take it! Somebody please explain that! My A1c went from 7.1 to almost 11. THIS DOES NOT WORK!!!

column2: redbud, 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: 20 units 2x a day works so far. at 110-150 and feel better. at first when hitting 100 i felt faint. after 3 months i'm getting better results at 40 units total than i was at 50 units. i also take 2 500 mg metformin.no pain using pen , but i have a high pain tolarance.  i was scaird of using needles and this pen reduced that fear very quicklyexspensive and will put me in the doughnut hole quickly next year.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was on 70/30 for several years.  Because my blood sugar would drop about 10:00AM if I was very active and rise again to between 150/200 in evening, my provider changed me to Levemir. 10 units twice daily, then 20, then 30 and now I am on 40 units with a fast acting on sliding scale also.  My sugar has gone up to average 355 in one month.  I think I need to go back to 70/30.

column2: rich, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: since starting levemir i feel iritable i have severe hip pain and now feels like its traversing down into my knee generally feel weak ,insonomia, feel tired , dont feel like excercising because of the pain, i usually excercise 1 to 2 hrs a day glucose levels are sky rocketing unable to controll  are now above 200 constantly.i'am now taking 50 unit 2x a day  got a call into the doc for help didnt have any of these side effects on  nph. i took lantus for a while it worked  ok but lost my insurance.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this treatment is awsome.  I love drugs.

column2: Looking for answers, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Not experiencing night hypos anymore - I'm told that by Dr that the following is not a side effect of Levemir but it did start about a week after I started using it so still not sure myself:  anxiety, insomnia and currently still struggling with rapid heart rate -on meds for it but no firm diagnosis as to actual cause as yet. Curious to know if anyone else has experienced anything similar after starting levemir?

column2: redtnt528@aol.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Since I started taking this insulin, I have not felt the same at all. I first became very aggitated, and restless, sometimes staying up half the night into the early morning hours. Also had a fast heart rate. Then I noticed that I was having muscle weakness, feeling so tired that I could barely make myself stay awake. My Dr tells me that this is my bodies way of going through withdrawl...I have been going through withdrawl for 3 months now! I have never seen anyone go through anything like this after switching insulins before, and my whole family is diabetic! So am I crazy, or is he a quack? My A1C did drop from 8.7 to 6.9, but I keep having to up the dose of the insulins, and am bloated all the time. I am MISERABLE since Ihave been on this stuff! Is anyone else having these side affects?

column2: passion84css528@yahoo.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Since I hve been on this medication, I have experienced some very unfavorable reations. First I was extremely aggitated,and had rapid heart rate. I now find that I feel muscle weakness, and am exhausted most of the time,and could sleep most of he day. Dr says this is my body going through withdrawl from A1C being at 8.4, and coming down to 6.9. This makes no sense to me at all. I have been on this for 3 months, How long does one go through withdrawl for crying out loud!? I should be feeling better, NOT worse!

column2: sonny, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: On lantus before.  Budget cuts put me on this insulin for 3 months now.  A1C over three months went from 5.9 to 9.7.  From 38 units of lantus to 86 and rising with levemir.  Still can't control blood sugars.

column2: musquiz, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Was put on this insulin by my provider to cut costs.  A1C went from 7.25 to 9.7 in 3 months.  I increased dose weekly cause my sugars stayed high all the time.  I increased dosage from 36 units to 75 units and still had problems with blood sugar.  It took about 9 months before I was able to go back to lantus.  I'm back down to 39 units.  I had no kidney problems before levemir and now have trace protein in my urine with blood.  Prior to this I've been very fortunate with no problems for 50 years of insulin dependance.  High blood sugar does kill.
